The Checkboxes module will already be very familiar to you if you've used the Pulldown module or the Tabs module. Ironically, if you're already familiar with the Sideview Checkbox module, you'll find this module really quite different. Whereas the Sideview Checkbox module implements a single checkbox element on the page, the Checkboxes module implements a whole group of checkboxes, and implements logic to automatically turn those selected checkboxes into a complex search expression.

As with a multiselect Pulldown or with a Tabs module, zero or more of the options (in this case checkboxes) can be 'statically defined', ie hardcoded in the module config, and zero or more can be "dynamically defined", ie where the labels and values of those checkboxes are pulled from field values in the current search results.

Since the Pulldown and Tabs modules are already extensively documented and this module is really derivative of their behavior, here we'll just move right to examples of static config, dynamic config, and then a combination of both static and dynamic.

module.name: Search
module.param: | stats count | eval name="foo,bar,baz" | fields - count | eval name=split(name,",") | mvexpand name | eval label=name+"Label" | eval value=name+"Value" | fields - name
